data.title: Definitely put this place on your list to try! !
data.text:
Just the name alone had us curious.  Time you walk in, you are greeted by the friendly staff. The ambiance is so nice and chill. From the unique artwork to cute napkins/ chopsticks  with a cute message. The music is upbeat giving you a nice vibe while you eat.
We had the snow crab hand rolls....delicious! 
Our main meal; chicken teriyaki bowl, chasu( braised pork) and the menchi katsu burger. Had the seasonal lemonade....all very tasty!! 

Would definitely go back!

data.title: You will love it!
data.text: Tasty ramen, great service by Donny. Check in on Yelp and get a free flavored Sake......cool vibe and karaoke  on Thursday nights

data.title: Not Compelling
data.text: Itsy Bitsy is ok, but it will probably take more than that to make a go of it in a city with some pretty great Asian restaurants.  The appetizers were very good, but the entrees (ramen and rice bowl) were nothing we'd order again.  Service was very good, and the atmosphere tried.

data.title: Awesome Tapas....for happy hour
data.text:
Went here before the Goo Goo dolls/ Collective Soul concert.  We did not have one bad appetizer or drink. They helped with parking and Waitress was great. Had one Gluten
 free and two vegetarians  with us and it all worked out!

data.title: Wow! What An Experience!
data.text: We started out with Shishito Peppers, Japanese Sweet Potato, and Pot Stickers.  We had never had Shishito Peppers, or Japanese Sweet Potato, but what a treat!  The Shishito Peppers are flash fried, and so yummy.  Who would have thought peppers on their own could be such a tasty appetizer!  They are not too hot, just flavorful.  The Japanese Sweet potato, was served with butter on it, and was so rich, and delicious.  It has some similarities to the sweet potato taste of a regular sweet potato, but has a bit sweeter taste, to me.  It is also a bit more hardy and less creamy in the center.  I believe it was baked.  I could have eaten one of these all on my own, and I plan on getting some of them to experiment with at home!  The potstickers were eaten by my husband and daughter (I can't have MSG, but the staff went out of its way to find out, and let me know what has MSG in it), and they thought they were the best they had ever had.  For dinner both my husband and daughter had the make your own ramen, and that was a really fun and both agreed, yummy experience!  Our waitress was so helpful in recommending, per each persons' taste preference what they might like, and add ins that they might enjoy as well.  I had the Chicken Katsu Sandwich with fries.  The chicken is fried, but not in the usual way one would think, I can't describe it, but it was not greedy, or heavy, and the breeding stuck to the sandwich to make each bite a delight.   There are seasonings on it, as well as a sauce on the chicken I was not familiar with (But it had no MSG, that they told me), but was delicious.  The fries were the like none I have ever had.  So crunchy and light on the outside, yet full of soft potato on the outside.  I am not sure what type of batter they use either, but it made the fries very flavorful.  My husband had the ramen and whiskey special, and loved it.  He said the Japanese Whiskey was amazing.  My daughter and I had the Lemonade of the day, and it was a treat!  I wish I could remember the flavor, but it was so delicious I paid for another to take with me!  For dessert we had three flavors of Mochi, which to me is like ice cream with a coating similar to a marshmallow on the outside.  All of the flavors were delicious, but I highly recommend the cookies and cream flavor.  The next time we are in Vegas we will be back to Itsy Bitsy, and I recommend it to anyone wanting something a bit out of the box.

data.title: 1 block of Fremont on first floor of The Ogden building
data.text:
We had reservations for 7 on a Monday night.  Seated quickly but then things moved very slowly.  The girl did her best and was super pleasant.  Bartender was trying to help her out.  They said they had a no show.

Other than speed the rest was great.  Ambiance is funky and so fun.  Music was amazing.  Small plates were great (edamame, seaweed salad).  Sushi was great, The hand rolls weren't rolled like I am used to but flavor was great.  Several got he ramen and I tasted two different varieties.  To most of us they were very over seasoned.  Like to the point of saying too salty.  Prices very reasonable.

data.title: My local watering hole
data.text: So this is now my daily watering hole. Happy hour 4-6pm $2 drafts, exceptional bar food. Small bites are a great way to try the various offerings. The saki flight is worth a try. Staff are friendly and attentive. 😎 And yes try the Japanese Whiskey.

data.title: Late Night Dining
data.text: My husband and I ordered spicy ramen, vege potstickers and edamame beans. Everything was excellent, customer service superb, DJ playin great hip hop and r&b jams, decor modern and edgy. Can't say enough good things about this place. Highly recommend

data.title: Do not miss this Happy Hour
data.text: Itsy Bitsy is a small bar/restaurant in downtown Las Vegas, very close to Freemont Street. Not only do they have amazing food, sake, and whiskey it is CHEAP! I am talking an entire menu of small bites starting at $2 ea. Not to mention the $2 PBR drafts and $7 sake bottles. My table of 3 ordered beer, sake, and every single thing I put in my mouth was AMAZING!! Killer Ramen, spicy edamame, chicken teriyaki rice bowls. Stop Reading and GET THERE!! You will not be disappointed. The service is also stellar. :)

data.title: I get excited to eat here
data.text: Happy hour is unbelievable. so many great deals. Drinks are awesome and so was the bartender. We order so much food I don't know where to begin. Japanese corn, my God! Giyoza, wowza! Ramen is AWESOME. The vibe of this place is awesome. The staff is beyond superb ..I can't help but tip big because they are that awesome. I get super excited when I get to visit and eat here. It's memorable to say the least and definitely in my top three restaurants. I love this place and miss it from the west coast everyday

data.title: Itsy Bitsy...I think not!
data.text: Between the wonderful food, great scotch, and phenomenal service, this was one of the highlights of our trip.  If you make the wise decision to save some of your gambling money and go to IBR&W, it will be money well spent.  Ask for Meg and she'll make sure that you are taken care of and that you have a great time.

data.title: Excellent place to go!
data.text: This places ambiance is excellent. Friends and I went Saturday night while cruising downtown. The DJ was great! The music never got bad even for a song. The food was insanely good! Had their spicy miso soup and it was probably the best i've ever had. The palce was just awesome; even the art work on the walls. Because we went during ahppy hour also, the price blew me away with how cheap it was. I would go here everyday if I was closer to it.

data.title: Super Bummed I Didn't Find This Sooner!
data.text: Great food with a killer location just off the DT strip.  Make your own Ramen ... who knew it could be so killer!  Clean, friendly and great eats.  Def an "off strip" endeavor that I'll be doing again!

data.title: Meeting Charlotteans in Vegas at my new fave spot!
data.text: Vegas of course is known for the over the top strip and glitz...after all the years I've come to this world renowned city...finally I'm feeling the love in the revitalized old Vegas! This little gem of a restaurant is a must visit...great food great bar tenders and a breath of nostalgia for this great city!

data.title: Good Hip place right off Fremont Street
data.text: This is a cool cozy spot a block off Fremont street that serves some awesome noodles. A must try is the Fiji Apple sake or the peach sake! The staff is extremely friendly an would recommend to stop by if your downtown

data.title: Contemporary ramen joint
data.text: I was amazed to find a restaurant with my love for ramen and whiskey.  Not your typical asian ramen restaurant as it is more of a contemporary feel.  The noodles were cooked proper and paired nicely with my flight of whiskey.  We left happy.

data.title: Not many know where this restaurant is located
data.text: I researched Ramen places as it is one of my husband's favorite foods.  This one is not far from Freemont street, so we decided to kill 2 birds at once.  Eat Ramen and take in the Freemont experience.  We order 2 appetizers and each our own ramen.  Very good food and quiet atmosphere.  This place is hard to find by following google it kept putting us in the wrong direction, we finally asked a police officer and they pointed us in the right direction.  Hope to return someday!

data.title: Very nice an intimate
data.text: Nice place to spend sometime eating noodles and have a cocktail in the New Downtown area. There is a pub and when we were there there was a DJ. You could eat inside or out.

data.title: Amazing all around!
data.text: This is not your college ramen.  This is a very cool spot in Downtown with a DJ spinning, cool decor, and fantastic food.  Everyone very much enjoyed their food and the service that we received from our waitress, was outstanding.  We were there Saturday February 20th and we couldn't be more happy with our waitress...the girls at our table couldn't get over her skin.  Creepers.  The ramen that I had was out of this world and the broth was the star.  The drinks were also very good here.  I am back home after my Vegas trip and am already missing the ramen and planning when I can come back here!

data.title: Very good value
data.text: This isn't the kind of ramen which is a life-changing experience (head to Monta in Chinatown for that), but it's a very pleasant introduction to that dish in downtown Las Vegas which is really good value, ramen-wise. A nice whiskey list (nothing too highbrow) and a fun atmosphere make this a good place to start for a fun night out.
